meta.name: description
meta.content: Mineral Wells Independent School District has six schools in its district from Pre-Kindergarten through 12th grade in Mineral Wells, Texas.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Palo Pinto schools, Rams, education, public schools, Mineral Wells ISD, Travis Elementary, Lamar Elementary, Houston Elementary, Mineral Wells High School, Mineral Wells Jr. High

span.div: Every Student. Everyday. Whatever It Takes.

img.h1: Mineral Wells Independent School District Home

div.br: MWISD offers numerous academic and athletic extra-curricular activities. Service organizations, clubs, and academic contests provide for a well-rounded school experience.

div.div:
Junior high and senior high students participate in competitive academics and sports governed by the University Interscholastic League (UIL).
Campus libraries are hubs for internet research and great reads.

div.br: The Mineral Wells Independent School District is committed to excellence. Academic achievement is the top priority for MWISD’s 3,250 students. It is truly a place where the needs of the students come first.

The children of this historic community attend three elementary schools, one junior high, and one high school (4A). The district also has the Mineral Wells Academy, a well-established alternative education center. A total district staff of 470 provides a quality education for students. Each campus has counselors, campus nurses, librarians, Teacher Academic Leaders, and technology specialist are an important part of this team.

Each of the district’s five schools are equipped with many technological resources. Our campuses encourage BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) programs. The high school has several classes offering itunes U courses that utilizes ipads. Two distance learning sites are also available in the district.

The school district reaches beyond its boundaries by working with Tarleton State University and Weatherford College in various programs to bring dual credit classes and professional development opportunities to MWISD.
Programs
Many innovative, challenging and varied programs are offered throughout the district to meet student needs and promote academic achievement. Academically gifted students in grades K-12 are accelerated programs to meet their needs. We have great fine arts and athletic programs. Ram Stadium has seating for over 7,000. Our core curriculum utilizes the TXResource System to provide a vertically aligned backbone for instruction. The high school has an extensive selection of technical and certification programs varying from auto mechanics, computer technology, career, agriculture, and culinary arts. The campus offers challenging advanced placement classes.

h3.a: MWISD End of Year FAQ for Parents and Students

div.div: Texas Governor Greg Abbott announced on April 17 an amended Executive Order calling for all Texas schools to remain closed through the end of the school year. This means Mineral Wells ISD facilities will remain closed and all events and activities are canceled through the end of May. MWISD has created the following page on our website that is devoted to frequently asked questions and our responses about the District's end of year plans...

h3.a: Preguntas frecuentes de fin de año de MWISD para padres y estudiantes

div.div: El gobernador de Texas, Greg Abbott, anunció el 17 de abril una Orden Ejecutiva enmendada que pedía que todas las escuelas de Texas permanecieran cerradas hasta el final del año escolar. Esto significa que las instalaciones de Mineral Wells ISD permanecerán cerradas y todos los eventos y actividades se cancelarán hasta finales de mayo. MWISD ha creado la siguiente página en nuestro sitio web que se dedica a las preguntas frecuentes y nuestras respuestas sobre los planes de fin de año del Distrito...

h3.a: Find Your Place at the Library-National Library Week April 19-25

div.div: National Library Week (April 19 - 25, 2020) is a time to celebrate the contributions of our nation's libraries and library workers and to promote library use and support. From free access to books and online resources for families to library business centers that help support entrepreneurship and retraining, libraries offer opportunity to all. The theme for National Library Week 2020 is " Find Your Place at the Library".
